proposals.reasoning: This team lines up with the broadest consensus from the table while avoiding stacking multiple early drivers together. Alice and Bob give us a consistent baseline from the early discussion, and Iris adds a quieter voice that several players independently endorsed as a reasonable low-risk inclusion. This composition should give us useful alignment information without overcommitting to any one early narrative.

votes.comment: I’m on the team, so this gives evil direct influence and an early chance to sabotage while still looking broadly reasonable to the table.
I’m on the team, it has broad cross-table support, and there are no strong early red flags; mission 1 is usually worth running for info.
Broad consensus pick that avoids stacking strong early drivers; reasonable info-gathering first mission with no standout red flags yet.
Team includes my evil teammate Alice, giving us sabotage potential or a trust-building success; better than a fully clean-looking trio.
There’s broad consensus for this as a reasonable, low-drama first mission, and it avoids overloading early drivers while still giving us useful info.
No obvious red flags and it reflects broad consensus without stacking multiple heavy early drivers; fine as an info-gathering first mission.
Broad consensus first mission team; rejecting it without specific suspicion would look needlessly contrarian this early.
Broad consensus pick that avoids stacking early drivers; good low-info first mission to gather alignment signals.
Good consensus pick for Quest 1, spreads risk without stacking the early drivers and gives us useful info with minimal downside.
Broad consensus pick that avoids stacking early drivers; good info-gathering first mission without overcommitting to any one narrative.

discussion.content: For the first mission I’d like a quieter, low-drama group—something like me, Bob, and Grace feels reasonable, and I’m especially wary of anyone who’s already pushing hard narratives this early.

I’m fine being on the first team, and I don’t mind Grace there, but I’d like to hear a bit more from Grace and maybe one of Charlie/Diana before we lock anything in so we’re not just defaulting to the first suggestion.

I’d rather we don’t just auto-lock Alice’s first suggestion—early “low-drama” pitches can hide evil—so I’d like at least one of Charlie/Diana/Iris rotated onto the first team instead of running all three of Alice/Bob/Grace together.

I agree we shouldn’t just rubber-stamp the first trio, but I’d still like at least one of Alice/Bob/Grace on there for a baseline, so something like Alice, me, and Grace feels like a decent compromise to start getting real info.

I like Diana’s compromise of Alice/Diana/Grace as a starting team—it keeps us anchored on at least one of the early voices without just handing the whole mission to the very first suggestion. I’m a bit wary of Charlie pushing to swap multiple people out before we’ve seen any cards on the table.

I’d rather not load the first mission with both Diana and Grace together when we’ve got so little to go on, so I’d lean toward something like Alice/Bob/Iris or Alice/Bob/Charlie as a calmer info-gathering team.

I’m okay being on first mission teams, but I’d rather we don’t stack it with too many of the earliest voices, so something like Alice / Bob / Diana or Alice / Bob / Iris feels like a safer way to start than putting both Diana and me together.

I’d rather start with a mix of one of Alice/Bob plus someone who’s been quieter like Iris, rather than bunching multiple early drivers like Alice/Diana/Grace together. Of the options mentioned, Alice/Bob/Iris or Alice/Bob/Charlie both feel like reasonable low-risk first missions.

I’m comfortable with an Alice/Bob/Iris team for the first mission since it lines up with several people’s “mixed but not overloaded” logic, and I’d rather avoid pairing both Diana and Grace together this early. If we do swap anyone, I’d only change one slot at most so we actually learn something from the result.

I like the convergence around Alice/Bob/Iris—there’s broad support from different corners, and I’m a bit hesitant to reward Charlie’s early push to reshuffle multiple slots before we have any real info.

proposals.reasoning: This keeps exactly one person from the failed first mission—Bob, who many are still comfortable with—while rotating out both Alice and Iris, the other suspects from that team. It also aligns with the earlier consensus that Bob–Charlie–Diana–Eve is a good balance of new information and perceived safety, and it’s consistent with what I and Henry previously supported, so it doesn’t look like a sudden pivot or overreaction.

votes.comment: Two of my evil teammates are on it and I’m not under scrutiny, so this is a great mission for us to sabotage.

I know I’m good, and removing both Alice and Iris isolates the known suspect pool to just one of them. This is a widely supported configuration that avoids the riskiest repeats without any stronger alternative evidence against Charlie/Diana/Eve yet.
I specifically wanted a team that avoided all of Alice/Bob/Iris this round; including Bob keeps us tied to the failed mission’s suspect pool when we could get a completely clean read instead.
I’m on it with Eve, so we have strong chances to sabotage while still looking like a balanced, reasonable team based on prior discussion.
It matches the earlier idea of keeping only one person from the failed team while adding mostly new faces, so it should give us good info without re‑risking the same exact pool.
Too many untested players clustered together and it keeps the same Diana–Eve core that several people already flagged as risky; I’d rather see at most one of them on this mission.
High chance at least one evil is on this team, and it matches what I previously supported so rejecting would look inconsistent.
I previously advocated this exact team; it keeps only one member from the failed mission, gives strong new info, and we can’t realistically avoid all risk anyway.
We know there’s at least one evil in Alice/Bob, so including Bob keeps that risk on the team when we could instead field a clean slate without anyone from the first mission pool.
I still want a team with none of Alice/Bob/Iris, since we know there’s at least one evil among them and we can easily avoid that whole pool this round.

discussion.content: We know there’s at least one bad among me, Bob, and Iris from that first mission, but a single fail often means just one evil slipped in—I'd lean toward keeping Bob and me for now and rotating Iris out for someone who hasn’t been tested yet.

Since I know I’m good, that fail means the spy is either you or Iris, Alice, so I’d rather we reset and send a mission with neither of you on it this round. Maybe we build around me plus two or three people who haven’t gone yet, like Charlie, Diana, and/or Eve.

Given that we *know* there’s at least one evil in Alice/Bob/Iris, I’d rather we build this team mostly from untested players—something like me, Diana, Eve, and one of the remaining new faces, and leave all three of them off this mission.

I don’t love completely throwing out everyone from the first team based on a single fail; I’d rather keep just one of that trio and mix in mostly new people—something like Alice, Charlie, me, and Eve feels like a reasonable balance of info and safety.

I’m with the idea of keeping exactly one person from the first mission, and Diana’s Alice–Charlie–Diana–me team feels like a good balance of fresh info without overreacting to a single fail. If we don’t like Alice specifically, we could swap her for Bob, but I’d prefer we stick close to that structure.

I’d rather not load the team with multiple completely untested players at once, and I especially don’t like pairing Diana and Eve together this early—something like Bob, Charlie, Iris, and one of Henry/Jack feels like a more balanced mix of info and risk.
I’d rather we only take one person from the first team and leave Iris off for now—something like Bob, Charlie, Diana, and Eve feels like a safer mix of info and risk to me.

I really don’t want Iris back on the team yet, and between the suggested options I’m most comfortable with something like Bob, Charlie, Diana, and Eve, since it keeps only one person from the failed mission while giving us a lot of new info.

Given we *know* there’s at least one evil in Alice/Bob/Iris and we only saw a single fail, I’d rather we leave all three of us off this one and go with mostly fresh faces—something like Charlie, Diana, Eve, and Henry/Jack. That gives us a cleaner read without immediately re‑risking the same pool.

I’d really like to see a team that completely avoids the Alice/Bob/Iris pool this round—something like Charlie, Diana, Eve, plus either Henry or me feels like the cleanest way to get new info without re‑risking the same suspects. If we keep forcing one of them on, we’re just muddying the reads longer.

proposals.reasoning: We need to avoid the most suspicious patterns: Bob has been on both failed missions (including the 2-fail), and Diana/Eve together produced the double-fail, so I’m hard-excluding Bob and not touching the Diana+Eve pair this round. Mission 1’s single fail came from among Alice, Bob, and Iris; given Bob’s extreme suspicion and Iris’s near-universal townread, Iris is the best anchor we have. Mission 2’s double-fail (Bob, Charlie, Diana, Eve) strongly suggests at least two evils in that group, so I’m avoiding all four for this critical mission. That leaves the relatively untainted pool of Frank, Grace, Henry, and Jack. Multiple players independently proposed building around Iris plus a mix from Grace/Henry/Jack (and sometimes Frank), and there’s strong table consensus that this is the safest cluster. As leader, I’m including myself (Henry) and then selecting Iris as the core, with Grace and Jack as the other two from this trusted pool, giving us a four-person team that completely avoids every highly suspicious name and all previous fail-team combinations while aligning with the broadest agreement from discussion.

votes.comment: This is basically all from the least-tested pool around Iris; I’d rather see one of Frank/Alice mixed in so we’re not putting so much blind faith in a single new cluster.

Given I know I’m good, there’s at least one evil in {Alice,Iris} and at least two in {Charlie,Diana,Eve}. This team avoids all of Alice/Charlie/Diana/Eve and me, and only risks Iris from the {Alice,Iris} pair plus at most one evil among {Frank,Grace,Henry,Jack}. Structurally this is about as safe as we can get for a must-succeed mission, so I’ll back it.
This matches the safest consensus pool: excludes Bob and the Diana+Eve pair from the double-fail, avoids all of Mission 2, and anchors on widely trusted Iris plus three relatively untainted players.
Fits the strong table consensus of avoiding Bob and the Diana+Eve pair; as someone not on it, I’m fine letting this relatively trusted cluster try.

This team is almost entirely drawn from the most widely trusted pool, which gives us very little information and risks handing a clean success to a group that might be wrong but never proven; I’d rather see at least one slot come from outside the Iris-centered consensus so we can actually test a suspect cluster.

Too many relatively untested players together; I’d prefer at least one from the Mission 1 team besides Iris to anchor around known info rather than a mostly fresh block that could hide coordinated evil.
Avoids Bob and the Diana/Eve pair from the double-fail, builds around widely trusted Iris plus a relatively clean pool; this is about as safe as we’ll get right now.

This avoids all highly suspicious players (Bob, Diana, Eve, and the entire Mission 2 team) while anchoring on widely townread Iris and using the cleanest remaining pool; it’s the safest structure we’re likely to get right now.

This team avoids all of Bob/Charlie/Diana/Eve, where we know there are at least two evils and strong suspicion on Bob. It matches the broadly trusted pool built around me plus Grace/Henry/Jack, and there’s no clearly safer alternative for this must-pass mission.

This avoids Bob and the Diana+Eve pair from the double-fail, excludes everyone from the 2-fail team, and uses the broadly trusted Iris + (Grace/Henry/Jack) cluster. Statistically the safest available mix.

discussion.content: Given two fails in a row, I really don’t want a team with any combo of Bob + (Diana/Eve) right now; I’d feel better about a mix that brings back Iris and maybe someone like Frank or Grace instead.

I get why I look bad being on both failed teams, but if I were evil I’d probably have played it safer on Mission 2 instead of doubling down into a 2-fail. I’m okay staying off this one if it helps trust, but I’d strongly avoid putting both Diana and Eve together again, and I’d like to see Iris back on the team.

Given I know I’m good and Mission 2 had two fails, at least two of Bob/Diana/Eve are evil, and Bob being on both failed teams makes him my top suspect. I’d like a team without Bob and preferably without pairing Diana and Eve together again—something like me, Iris, and two from {Frank, Grace, Henry, Jack} (maybe Alice but I’m a bit cautious there).

Given the double-fail on Mission 2, I really don’t want Bob anywhere near this next team, and I’d feel safest with a core like Iris plus a couple from Frank/Grace/Jack, with me or Charlie filling the last slot if needed.
I’m with everyone on keeping Bob off this one, and I really like Iris as a core; I’d be comfortable with a team like Iris, Alice, and two from Frank/Grace/Henry.

Given Bob was on both failed missions and we saw a double-fail with Diana and Eve together, I’d really like to avoid all three of them this round. I’d be happiest with something like Iris plus a mix from Charlie/Henry/Jack (and I’m fine being included too if people are comfortable with that).

I’m very much on board with keeping Bob off this one and not pairing Diana and Eve together again; Iris feels like the safest anchor, and I’d like to see a team built around her plus a mix from Charlie/Frank/Henry/Jack (and I’m happy to be included if people are okay with that).

Given two straight fails and Bob on both, I really want him off this team, and I’d avoid pairing Diana and Eve again; I’m most comfortable with something like Iris plus a mix from Charlie/Frank/Grace/Jack (and I’m okay being on it too if people want that).

I’m very much on board with keeping Bob off this one and not pairing Diana and Eve again; I’d like to see a team built around me plus two or three from Charlie/Frank/Grace/Henry/Jack. If we really want a fourth outside that pool, I’d lean slightly toward Alice over revisiting the Mission 2 group.

I’m very much on board with keeping Bob off this and not pairing Diana and Eve again; I’d like to see a team of Iris plus a mix from Charlie/Frank/Grace/Henry (and I’m fine being the fourth if people are comfortable with that).
